item.body: Brands: Chacok, Save the Queen, Mariella Burani, Bleu Blanc Rouge, Indies, JC Trigon, Van RYB.

item.title: Mireille van den Borne
item.body: The house "van den Borne" takes her wellknown place by the elegance and the quality of her creativity. Created in 1935, this house makes exclusive hats, handmade and according with your desires, what the color and the shape concern.

item.title: Pin'Art - Antiques
item.body: The passion of India and authentic English and Portuguese colonial furniture. Chinese furniture, shimmering fabrics, original jewellery, purchases that will make your heart skip a beat.

item.title: Reservoir Shop
item.body: A new ?concept store? full of clothes, shoes, magazines and old discs. Warmly recommended by enthusiasts of arty, trendy fashion!

item.title: Gesso
item.body: Gesso manufactures mouldings, columns, wall lamps and other ornaments in plasters, but also restores old ceilings or creates new items in plasters on-measures.

item.title: Le Jardin d'Apollon
item.body: The place to go to for bonsai, Le Jardin d?Apollon sells not only a wide range of species, but also all you need to ensure they live and grow in harmony. After all, bonsai are inseparable from interior decorating, feng shui, statues of Buddha and wooden artefacts. However, what makes this shop special is the advice and service supplied by its owner, a true aficionado, who will even take care of your bonsai while you are away or if it falls sick.

item.title: Sol Luna
item.body: Silver jewellery, clothes and items from Asia.

item.title: La Bande des Six Nez
item.body: Strip cartoons of every kind! Permanent gallery of silk-screen prints, lithography,... New and second hand comic strips.

item.title: Demeuldre
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Demeuldre represents the most famous brands of crystal, china and silverware, with a collection of over 40,000 references. Their experience and customer service culture are transmitted from generation to generation since 1830.

item.title: Vandenhende
item.body:
Kenny Vandenhende and Marc Lindekens met on a chocolate course. Their workshop-boutique was established shortly afterwards, based on an original idea. The former is a chocolatier and the latter an ice cream maker. Together they explore these two worlds with passion and talent. There’s nothing fancy. Everything is kept simple, using high quality raw materials and ensuring a warm, professional welcome. Both partners are keen to keep their links with their customers, dividing their time between the workshop and the counter. They offer sound advice and adapt their products based on the feedback they receive from customers. Vandenhende will make to order and is happy to work from raw materials provided by... its customers.
From the minute they step through the door, visitors are transported by the aroma of grilled almonds and cocoa (the workshop is behind the shop) and are likely to leave accompanied by a smile from their welcoming hosts.

Open Tuesday to Thursday, 12 noon to 19.00. Friday and Saturday, 10.00 to 19.00. Sunday 10.00 to 13.00.

item.title: Luc Genot
item.body: Large selection of beaded necklaces and semi-precious stones. Graduated from the University of Nantes in Gemology. Expertise, repair and manufacture. Fellow of the Gemmological Association of Great Britain.

item.title: Frantz Hemeleers Antiquités
item.body: In 1975, Frantz Hemeleers opens a small 80m² Antique Shop on avenue des Casernes (between bd Général Jacques and La Chasse) in Etterbeek district. Throughout the years Frantz Hemeleers expands his business and becomes an enthusiastic antique dealer and collector. Moreover, he widens the range of furniture, ornaments and collecting pieces; sometimes coming from England, France, Sweden and Belgium. Subsequently, Frantz Hemeleers continues his pursuit of Beauty by always looking for objects of higher quality in terms of style, age and value: such as for example, polished items or inlaid furniture with marquetry decoration. At the present time, Frantz Hemeleers Antique Shop consists of 600m2 and proposes a variety of items as well as some pieces of exceptional quality and rarity dating back to the seventeenth, the eighteenth, the nineteenth and sometimes the twentieth century. The store is very often renewed and each piece of furniture firstly visits Frantz Hemeleers? workshop before being presented to the public. In this shop you will discover a huge selection of furniture such as desks, bookcases, tables, chairs, armchairs, sofas, chests, cabinets, console tables ?as well as a vast range of ornaments, pictures, mirrors, candlesticks, lamps, silverware, bronzes,? In other words, Frantz Hemeleers Antique Shop is an ideal place to find the perfect gift.

item.title: Sterling Books
item.body: English Librairy

item.title: New Dewolf
item.body: Bric-a-brac with an arty touch. At New Dewolf you can find a bit of everything - from ornaments and sofas to Christmas garlands and chandeliers. Ali-Baba?s cave spread over more than 2,000 square metres!

item.title: Oxfam - Magasins du Monde
item.body: A pair of shoes, a dress, a bag or an ornament: all Oxfam articles come from Fair Trade commerce.

item.title: Bellerose
item.body: This top international chain offers modern, urban fashion for everybody.

item.title: Stijl
Gabriele Vintage
item.body: Gabriele lets you discover a superb collection of clothes and accessories from the twenties to the eighties, all selected for their originality, quality and character. This boutique is a true treasure trove where original and individual creations intermingle with garments made by great designers. Drop in and discover all the pleasure of true vintage.

item.body: ISABEL MARANT-ALEXANDER WANG-GOLDEN GOOSE-VANESSA BRUNO-THAKOON
item.address: Place du Nouveau MarchÃ© aux Grains 5/Nieuwe Graanmarkt 5

item.title: Annemie Verbeke
Y-dress ?
item.body: Aleksandra Pazkowska casts a different glance at fashion by proposing designs that are beautiful, playful, simple and that cultivate the art of turning clothes upside-down and inside-out: convert your skirt into a party dress, your t-shirt into a pair of trousers or your towel into a beach dress.

item.title: Johanne Riss
item.body: Haute couture for ladies. Will lycra which transforms thin and rounds in sirens. A shop where space dilates without end, a place filled of creative energy.
item.address: Place du Nouveau MarchÃ© aux Grains 35/Nieuwe Graanmarkt 35

item.title: Carine Gilson
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 
Carine Gilson is one of the very few designers to consider underwear as überwear. The finest Lyon silk, the airiest Chantilly lace, the cheeky range of colors, the most generous cuts, the hand-crafted haute couture: nothing is too good. Carine Gilson's lingerie couture uses traditional methods to blend the finest materials with a classic aesthetic

item.title: Kartell
item.body: Specialised in plastic design objects, Kartell has developed a personal style, characterized in its quest for transparency, thanks to privileged collaboration with some of the biggest designers, such as Starck, Urquiola, Meda, Citterio, Lissoni...

item.title: Espace Bizarre
item.body: A spacious, minimalist location brimming over with treasures. Completely dedicated to design, Espace Bizarre is the ideal place to go if you are looking to (re)decorate your interior. The boutique has a vast and original collection of furniture and very refined high-quality accessories.

item.title: Shop Magritte
item.body:
The boutique and bookshop give you the possibility to support and promote the museum's activities, whilst at the same time proposing a range of articles allowing you to prolong your museum experience.

As well as a large and diverse selection of postcards, posters and original souvenirs, you can find general and more detailed reference books about Magritte and the period in which he worked. The shops interior and contents also reflect the artist's approach, mirroring the play between confrontation and meaning, which is demonstrated in a space where reproductions convey the artist's original ideas.

item.title: La Boîte à Musique
item.body: Great collection of classical music.

item.title: Galler Grand-Place
item.body:
Since 1976, Jean Galler has been producing unique, innovative creations in which to rediscover the authentic taste of chocolate. There are few chocolatiers who offer such a wide product range: bars, slabs, pralines, spreads, langues de chat, marzipans,… and flavours: praline, raspberry, coconut, coffee, biscuit,… and many more besides!
 
 
Open daily, from 10AM to 10PM
The Chocolate Pass is not on sale in these shops.

item.title: Neuhaus
item.body:
Neuhaus, Belgium’s leading luxury chocolate manufacturer, brings all its expertise and exacting standards to the production of its exceptional pralines. 155 years of knowledge, creativity and elegance, but above all a genuine passion for chocolate!
 
Open Monday to Thursday and Sunday, 9AM to 10PM. Friday and Saturday, 9AM to 11PM.
 
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Corné Port-Royal (Galerie de la Reine)
item.body: Backed by 80 years of experience, Belgian chocolatier, Corné Port-Royal, continues the tradition of time-honoured recipes and gourmet craft. Some fifty craftsmen work daily to manufacture chocolates to recipes that have remained unchanged for almost a century!

item.title: Dandoy
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Set in the heart of Brussels, the family-owned Biscuiterie Dandoy has perpetuated a unique craftsmanship in the production of many traditional Belgian and Brusselian specialties for almost two centuries. Dandoy's most famous specialties include the pain à la grecque, the speculaas, the almond breads, and several kinds of macaroons.

item.title: Mr Ego
item.body: A store for really original shopping! And the clientele is as heterogeneous as the clothes, shoes and accessories. Live DJ sets add special ambience.

item.title: Vincent
item.body: Specialist of the tie.

item.title: De Greef
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
Years are like carats for De Greef. They measure the value of the work that has been accomplished.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Their world – that of jewelry and fine watch-making draws its most precious facets from these years: continuity and emotion! A work of art and patience, each De Greef piece is a sculpture which takes time.

item.title: Kipling
item.body: Founded in Antwerp in 1987, Kipling has become a worldwide known brand. This leather store offers a range of bags that are effortlessly stylish, colorful and fun as well as practical and durable for even the most active individual. It also offers other accessories such as sunglasses, shoes, jewellery and watches.

item.title: Delvaux
item.body:
Founded in 1829, Delvaux is the oldest fine leather luxury goods company in the world. It has remained a family-owned company, precisely because it wants to protect those values of quality, exclusivity and taste.
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Avec/Met Plaizier
item.body: The concept: old Brussels post cards, calendars and books with a striking vintage touch

item.title: Galerie Bortier
item.body: Here you are guided through the gallery by the smell of old books before coming across the B-Gallery which features the work of some of Brussels' youngest artists, many of them exposing for the first time. If you like bargain hunting, take a literary pause in this calm and quiet gallery.

item.title: Rubbrecht
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
Lace and favour
 
The first writings on lace in Belgium occurred in the 15th century when Charles the Great ordered that lace making techniques were to be taught in the schools and the convents of the provinces of Belgium. Lace continues to be made by needle in the name of `Renaissance' and `Princess', this being produced by the traditional method of workers working at home.

item.title: Belgian Art
item.body: Situated at the Grand?Place in the historic city centre of Brussels, Belgian Art shops proposes a large selection of laces and tapestry of a high quality. Belgian Art is keen to make known and to perpetuate the traditions and history of Belgian culture.

item.title: La boutique Tintin
item.body: No need to say more: all Hergé?s works are here. A lovely shop with lovely objects that are now quite rare.

item.title: Pêle-Mêle
item.body:
Everything is second-hand here. The store buys and sells books, discs and games from all eras and for all ages.
Pêle-Mêle has Brussels? best collection of low-price albums.

item.title: Wittamer
item.body:
Heirs to a tradition dating back over 100 years, Myriam and Paul Wittamer continue their craft in a constant search for perfection.
 
They select and assemble the finest cocoa grands crus to produce delicate combinations with creative and harmonious flavours.
 
Open Monday, 9AM to 6PM. Tuesday to Saturday, 7AM to 7PM. Sunday from 7AM to 6.30PM

item.title: Marcolini - Minimes
item.body:
Pierre Marcolini travels the world to find increasingly rare beans which he transforms in his workshop into the finest, most delicious couverture chocolates … the epitome of chocolate making!
 
Open Monday to Thursday and Sunday, 9AM to 7PM. Friday and Saturday, 10AM to 8PM
 
 
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Diane von Fürstenberg
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
One of the premier names in American fashion, Diane von Furstenberg was founded in 1972 by the designer. Renowned for its iconic wrap dress and signature prints, DVF has grown into the global luxury lifestyle brand it is today. "Women have always inspired me...and I design to inspire them." - Diane von Furstenberg

item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
A Dinh Van creation stands out and may be distinguished from a thousand others. Contemporary and timeless, it offers its pure and simple shapes to women, men and children. The entire dimension of these sensual, essential pieces of jewelry is revealed as they become one with those who wear it.

item.body:
Our House offers a wide choice of furniture, firemantles, chandeliers, paintings and decorative arts, mostly european from the 18th and 19th centuries. Our workshops produce following the rules of craftsmanship luminaries: Sconces, lanterns; and ironworks, mainly copied from antique originals.
To equip your fireplace you will also find here a unique selection of cast iron backplates, but also antique and modern accessories for the fire.

item.body: The YellowKorner gallery exhibits its photographs in a townhouse that is typical of Brussels' architecture and invites visitors from the four corners of Europe to discover its body of artists.

item.body: The greatest specialist in slippers since 1908.

A melting pot of genres to satisfy the needs of all types of readers: reviews, comic strips, books on art, paperbacks, etc. As well as a selection of CDs and DVDs.

item.body: (not available) Une gamme de plantes aromatiques et d'épices pour la santé, la cuisine, la cosmétique mais surtout pour le plaisir.

item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Since 1846, House De Geest is the expert in premium dyeing and dry cleaning. De Geest is also cleaning, repairing, renewing furs, leathers and other suede clothing as well as giving back the initial glow to your carpets, curtains, drapes and armchairs.
 
.

item.title: Frederic Blondeel
item.body:
Do you like Belgian chocolate? Then you'll love the delicious chocolates from Chocolatier Frederic Blondeel who contributes masterfully to the Belgian reputation. The Frederic Blondeel delicacies are a real delight for your tongue.
 
Tea-Room

item.title: Maison Martin Margiela
Le Fabuleux Marcel de Bruxelles
item.body: On top making lemeilleur marcel in the universe, Marcel is now a lot more than marcels. We like to look at fashion in another way. D'accord, that sounds a bit cheesy and ridicule, but we don't really see ourselves as a fashion brand. We just enjoy making cool clothes premium quality toujours with a lot of nostalgie. We got our inspiration from ou parent's or grandparent's old clothes and added a touch of today.

item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
When Pierre Draps created his first pralines in Brussels, Belgium, in 1926, he established the foundations of sophistication, innovation, purity and passion which became the Godiva Chocolatier. Under the name borrowed from Lady Godiva, whose legendary ride on horseback symbolises style, sensuality and daring, Godiva’s craftsmen still decorate their chocolates by hand. The chocolates have been specially designed to transform any occasion into an unforgettable experience: with family or friends or as a personal treat.

item.title: Galler (Université)
item.body:
Behind the Galler chocolate factory is a creative artist: Jean Galler was born into a family of dessert makers … He founded his chocolate factory at the age of 21. More than 30 years later, the fundamentals remain the same: a passion for chocolate, a love of perfection and infinite creativity.
Today, Jean Galler and his team take pride in their task: to create a chocolate experience that constantly stirs the emotions. Their products are made exclusively from top quality, natural ingredients.
 
Since 1976, Jean Galler has been producing unique, innovative creations in which to rediscover the authentic taste of chocolate. There are few chocolatiers who offer such a wide product range: bars, slabs, pralines, spreads, langues de chat, marzipans,… and flavours: praline, raspberry, coconut, coffee, biscuit,… and many more besides!

Open van dinsdag tot zaterdag van 10u tot 19u. Maandag van 14u tot 19u.

Proud of its experience and know-how in personalised chocolates, Concept Chocolate is delighted to offer you an opportunity to learn all about the art of chocolate making. Time-honoured production, natural products, 100% cocoa butter and respect for the great tradition of Belgian chocolate are the qualities that have made Concept Chocolate the specialist in personalised chocolate and packaging.

item.body: Devoted to natural products and fair trading, this establishment operates along three main lines: the sale of items that are organic or sourced from the solidarity economy, the sampling of the daily specials, breakfasts and takeaway dishes, and making consumers aware of sustainable themes.

item.body: Second hand books

item.title: Casse Noisettes
item.body: Welcome to toy kingdom, for small and large children. Treasures include traditional wooden toys, disguises, construction models and passionate adult society games.

item.title: Luxiol
item.body: For twenty years now, likeable proprietor Marc Jaumaux has been collecting and offering a full range of wooden toys, Chinese puzzles, strategy and board games for all ages. Mobiles, rocking-horses, tricycles, juggling equipment and music boxes all contribute to an atmosphere of childhood regained. A superb range of silver jewellery, accessories and decorative items also help make Luxiol the ideal gift shop!

item.body: Beer Mania suggest you more than 400 traditional belgian beers. Also concert of jazz.

item.body: This place is one of the trendiest shops in Brussels. The clothing is original, with prices to match. Has also vintage decoration items.

item.title: Look 50
item.body: Second-hand clothes shop with a vintage style. You?ll find all the accessories, clothes and shoes you need for a retro look. You just have to rummage around a bit!

item.title: Kusje
item.body: The place to shop for girls? clothes. Lots of original colours and designs, side-by-side with the latest brands.

item.title: Les Choux Verts

A bit of nature for mum and baby. Organic clothes, bedding, washable nappies and more.
Clothes for babies from 0 to 4 years.

item.body: 70 years of experience Selective and exclusive range of piano brands Specialisation and expert knowledge in the field of transportation, tuning, maintenance and restoration Professional advice by our piano consultants Complementary team of forty employees Specialisation on each part of a piano Tailor-made service by providing all possible purchase, leasing and renting systems Maene financing A renowned workshop Historic museum with Chris Maene's private collection Specialised concert leasing with an exclusive Steinway-fleet of instruments Three branches in Ruiselede, Ghent and Brussels Two concert halls in our shops in Ruiselede and Brussels Pleasant, atmospheric surrounding Easy accessible Opened all year round

item.body: This specialist British bookshop offers a vast choice of books and magazines in English.

item.title: International Home of Cooking
item.body: The specialist in kitchen accessories, of all types. The store brims with original gift ideas, from small spoons to cook books.

item.title: Desmecht
item.body: Situated in the heart of Brussels, the herbalist Desmecht has been in existence since 1840. The shop sells dried herbs, infusions, nutritional supplements, natural cosmetics, argan oil, sweet almond oil and other natural oils.

item.title: Kausynoe
item.body: A small boutique with clothing, accessories and decoration. The owner works with Belgian brands and the creator Conni Kaminski.

item.title: Dominique Polain
item.body: To make other people happy or, why not, just for yourself. All sorts of hand-made jewellery at all sorts of prices: pearls, stones, silver, fabrics,? an enchanting concentration of glamour.

item.title: Atchoum
item.body: This shop aims to be polyvalent, even though its various types of pearls take up most of the space. You?ll also find clothes, decorative objects and an exhibition area.

item.title: Foxhole
item.body: Real inspiration in the district: a shop dedicated to second-hand clothing for men and women, as well as accessories. This is the ?Vintage Shop? that you can also find in the Dansaert district.

item.title: Art Shop 73
item.body: If you want to have a frame made, come with your photo of mummy, fido or your favourite postcard. Art Shop 73 will transfer it onto a sheet of pvc in whatever colour you fancy.

item.title: Le Pain Quotidien
item.body:
With beginning of the year 90, Alain Coumont is cook in a great restaurant of Brussels.
For its preparations, this in love a tasty kitchen and authenticates use that ingredients of quality. Only one black spot: it does not manage to find a bread answering its criteria. Qu' with that does not hold. It will manufacture it itself and it will be a leavened bread. L' opening of its workshop of production is quickly followed by inauguration a first store in the street " tendance" of Brussels, Antoine Dansaert.

item.title: Filippa K
item.body: Women's collection, accessories, blouses, dresses, jackets, jeans, knits, outerwear, shoes, skirts, tights, tops, trousers Men's collection, accessories, jackets, jersey, jeans, knits, outerwear, shirts, shoes, trousers

item.title: Super Green Me the ecoshop
item.body: Open only since last December, SuperGreenMe is THE eco-bio shop of the Dansaert district. From ecological baby?s nappies to biological cleaning products, everything is green here!

item.title: Just In Case
item.body: Just in Box is a mark of famous Belgian mode which is sold in a considerable number of countries. The designers Vicky Vinck and Katrien Strijbol. The collection seeks to explore the limits of the former styles of mode in their adding at the same time romantic details and to the mode. The women who carry Just in Box never do not pass unperceived and are often spontaneously congratulated for the choice on their clothes.

item.title: Underwear
item.body: Top-of-the-range underwear and bathwear fashions for women/men.

item.title: Passa Porta Bookshop
item.body: Brussel's international house of literature. Passa Porta is a meeting place for lovers of literature as well as those who create literature, a space where the link between Dutch, French and foreign-language literature is reinforced.

item.body: ?Our concept is to sell everything we like? explains the initiator of this attractive concept store. item.title: Carine Gilson
item.body: Carine Gilson is one of the rare designers to imagine the lingerie otherwise than as a simple accessory. Being inspired every season on an artistic subject (The Russian ballets, Klimt, the art nouveau, the Art deco which are her favourite periods), she imagines divine fineries and delicate lingerie. The materials are surprising: the magnificent Lyon?s silks, the lightest muslin, the most delicate Chantilly laces, the audacious palettes of colors as well as the remarkable cuts; all craft realisations in a « haute couture » spirit. Divine fineries, bras, breeches, gowns, strings, negligees, kimonos,? every piece is really unique. This kind of product was only possible thanks to the rigour of the manufacturing and production in the workshop in Anderlecht, and by the work of ultra-qualified seamstresses with fairy?s hands. She seduces the most prestigious shops and departments stores from New York to Tokyo, passing through Paris and London.

item.title: Frantz Hemeleers AntiquitÃ©s
item.body: In 1975, Frantz Hemeleers opens a small 80m² Antique Shop on avenue des Casernes (between bd Général Jacques and La Chasse) in Etterbeek district. Throughout the years Frantz Hemeleers expands his business and becomes an enthusiastic antique dealer and collector. Moreover, he widens the range of furniture, ornaments and collecting pieces; sometimes coming from England, France, Sweden and Belgium. Subsequently, Frantz Hemeleers continues his pursuit of Beauty by always looking for objects of higher quality in terms of style, age and value: such as for example, polished items or inlaid furniture with marquetry decoration. At the present time, Frantz Hemeleers Antique Shop consists of 600m2 and proposes a variety of items as well as some pieces of exceptional quality and rarity dating back to the seventeenth, the eighteenth, the nineteenth and sometimes the twentieth century. The store is very often renewed and each piece of furniture firstly visits Frantz Hemeleers? workshop before being presented to the public. In this shop you will discover a huge selection of furniture such as desks, bookcases, tables, chairs, armchairs, sofas, chests, cabinets, console tables ?as well as a vast range of ornaments, pictures, mirrors, candlesticks, lamps, silverware, bronzes,? In other words, Frantz Hemeleers Antique Shop is an ideal place to find the perfect gift.

item.title: Stéphane Goosse
item.body:
In the middle of the avenue Louise, behind a black canopy with white letters, opens on a brand new space of the interior decorator Stéphane Goosse.
 
 
Elegant and refined, very cosy and warm, it must absolutely be discovered !
 
Here, one forgets the tumult of the street. The surrounding music guides the steps of the visitor, from one room to another, between the visible stones and the coating fabricated with such a skill that they become precious and voluptuous and take the aspect of very thin skins. Managed with a showmanship and with virtuosity, it is easy to see in the place, in watermark, the different message of a designer-interior decorator who became unavoidable and who shows his preferences for the 18th century and contemporary art and mixes them with an exquisite taste. "I like the rythm in the decoration. Everyone asks a different accent. One should avoid redundancy and set in place a crescendo of discoveries and atmospheres", he said. The accent is set on sweet and sensual materials or contrasts good for their image.
 
The direct and indirect lightning, adjusted with taste, draws a landscape where the chosen furniture is standing near objects with a certain presence.
 
"One must feel that all those objects speak together and that the conversation is going well", he said with enthusiasm. A coherence, like a signature that one finds back in his realizations and art works! "
 
 
 
 
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Howards
item.body:
The Howards jewelry was established in 1977. It is situated in Sablon for 20 years. The founder shares with you his passion for the luxury and the perfectly designed jewels. As specialist of the hand-made jewel, he is also an ambassador of famous brands as Casato, Centoventuno, Mangiarotti, Marco Bicego, Mattioli, Scheffel and Poiray.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Scabal
item.body:
Scabal has become a designer and manufacturer of the finest ready-to-wear menswear and personalised made-to-measure clothing, allowing their customers to perfect the art of self-expression through their clothing.
 
 
Scabal pioneered the made-to-measure concept some 25 years ago and is still one of the leading companies in personalised made-to-measure garments. It has also remained true to its roots and is one of the most innovative developers of new fabrics, creating new fabric qualities year after year, such as Gold Treasure, Diamond Chip, Temptation, Lapis Lazuli, Summit, Private Line. In this regard, Scabal is constantly engaged in research for ever finer and more luxurious fibres and fabric qualities.
 
Scabal's production capacities are divided between a weaving plant in Yorkshire and a clothing factory in Saarbrücken. Read more on our structure.
 
Each season, Scabal's designers develop 20 to 30 new fabric qualities and for each fabric, 30 to 40 new designs and colours. All fabrics are stocked at the Brussels headquarters.
 
Scabal now has a presence in most European countries as well as in other major centres around the world.
 
In 1996, Scabal launched an accessory line, an exclusive range of items including shirts, ties, knitwear and belts so that its customers can look a 'Gentleman' from head to toe.
 
The accessories are made in Italy by the best craftsmen and, like the fabrics, are produced using materials of the finest quality.
 
Scabal never ceases in its quest to refine its products further and to offer top-level quality and service !
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Kings and Queens
item.body: Kings and Queens is an hairdressing salon.

item.title: Librairie The Skull
item.body: Founded in 1970. Dedications four times a month, exhibitions, manga, bookplates, silkscreens.

item.title: Le Dépôt
item.body: The whole world of strip cartoons.

item.title: Het B-Gevaar
item.body:
Situed in the Brussels' centre, Het B-Gevaar is the only bookshop where you can buy comics exclusively in Dutch version.
You can also visit a gallery that presents the work of more or less famous authors.

item.title: Le Dépôt
item.body: Comics and news or second hand silkscreens, DVD's, action figures, ...

item.title: Centre Belge de la Bande DessinÃ©e
Comic Strip House
item.body: Celebrating the greatest masters of the Belgian school of comic strip (Marcinelle), this place puts on permanent and temporary exhibitions of famous comic strip heroes. Meet Gaston, Spirou, Lucky Luke, the Smurfs and many others, who all emerged from the pen of the greatest Belgian cartoonists.

item.title: Laurent Gerbaud
item.body:
Laurent Gerbaud, craftsman chocolatier based in Brussels, has been creating combinations of chocolate, fruit and spices for almost 9 years. He has continued to produce combinations of flavours that appeal to him. The ingredients in each of his creations are all chosen from the best available and each item is hand-crafted.The sophisticated packaging enhances the appearance of the products and makes them irresistible to temptation as a gift or indulgent treat.
 
Open daily from 10:30 to 19:30

item.title: Zaabär
item.body:
Place of manufacture and sale, the Zaabär Factory Shop is a single place where to discover the lower parts of the trade of chocolate seller. Decorated like a factory, with the flavour of the melting chocolate, with preparations in progress, the decoration is simple and modern. Chocolate bars, bites of cereals, coated fruits or cookies, spices, nougatines… The workshop also includes a sales and tasting place where it is possible to find all the Zaabär creations. The Zaabär Factory Shop regularly accommodates the chocolate-lovers for one evening between friends or colleagues, or for one afternoon among children.
 
Open from Monday to Friday, from 10AM to 6PM and Saturday, from 11AM to 7PM

item.title: Faisons Un Rêve
item.body: The attraction for Scandinavian design, through vases and hallmarked jewellery, as well as Italian lamps from the 50s to 70s are special features of the gallery.

item.title: Filigranes
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Not far from Rue de la Loi, this library has the specificity of being open 365 days a year. One can find one of the vastest choices in Brussels. All tastes are satisfied: child books, strip cartoons, novels, books on multiple subjects; the offer is completed by a relaxation area where one can drink a good coffee while browsing a few pages of the future acquisition.

item.title: Serendip Spa
item.body: Enter a journey beyond time and space...where healing begins and stress ends...enter a space of luxury, ancient wisdom, light and joy...feel your senses replenish...and the weight of the body lightened

item.title: Senteurs d'ailleurs
item.body: The boutique Senteurs d'Ailleurs is a different type of space: it has bridged the gap between a straightforward perfume store and the so called concept store so popular now. The idea is to be neither of these two but instead to create an ambiance which simply visually matches the refinement of the products it houses.

item.title: Senses Art-Nouveau
item.body:
The Senses Art Nouveau Shop is situated in Rue Lebeau 31, near the Sablon in the center of Brussels. It has been created by a couple of passionate, Isabelle Leloup and her husband Jacopo Giola.

Tired to see all the shops in the world presenting the same old thing they decided to concentrate on a particular subject unique to Brussels: Art Nouveau. Looking for originality, quality and style, Isabelle and Jacopo have assembled an omogenous offer in what people describe a "very beautiful shop".

The Shop opened in 1998 and since then we had so many clients asking for catalogues and mail orders that we have opened this web site to get in touch all over the world.

In the Shop in Brussels and here on the web, Senses Art Nouveau presents the same selection of high quality Art Nouveau Reproductions and original Art Nouveau Fashion Accessories.

item.title: Museum Shop
item.body: Treat yourself or your friends. The Museumshop has a wide range of a articles connected with art. What about a piece of jewellery designed by Modigliani, a tie designed by Warhol or Dufy, a T-shirt inspired by Magritte, diaries, calendars, etc. Children will find games and books selected for their pleasure and their education. There is an excellent choice of books and CD-ROMS, devoted in particular to art books, notably all those which have been published by our museum. Our selection of post cards and posters contains reproductions of more than 400 works from our collections or foreign collections.

item.title: Banque dessinée
item.body: " Banque Dessinée " is the first room for sale by auction dedicated to comics, books and toys for collection.

item.title: Le Salon d'art et de Coiffure
item.body:
An extraordinary experience to enjoy in Brussels: have your hair done in an art gallery. Jean Marchetti, a hairdresser - gallerist - editor, and the boss, invites you to discover the artist of the day while promising you the hairstyle of your dreams.

Salon open from Tuesday to Friday from 2 to 6.30 p.m., on Saturday from 9.30 a.m. to noon and from 2 to 6 p.m.

item.title: Les Petits Papiers
item.body:
On 12 March 2012, the gallery of Petits Papier moves to the Grand Sablon. The season 2012 will open with Philippe Geluck and his Cat.
Afterwards, the Petits Papiers will present tandems of artists, one from Comic Strip Art and the other from Contemporary Art.
Several examples : Hervé di Rosa and Philippe Druillet, Pat Andrea and Jacques de Loustal, Claude Viallat and François Avril.

item.title: Little Nemo
item.body: Sale & purchase of comic strips. Expert in old comic strips. Free estimate

item.title: Hors Série
item.body: Very wide selection of jazz (vinyl and CD). Also an extensive range of comics, DVDs and art books. Regular exhibitions about jazz.

item.title: Forbidden Zone
item.body:
Three floors dedicated to US and european comics, mangas...
Figurines, posters, port_folios...
Dedications and exhibitions

item.title: Galerie Quadri
item.body:
The Quadri Gallery focuses on the work of historical avant-gardes through Pure Plastic, Abstract Art, Mesures, Dada, Surrealism, Phases, Cobra, Phantomas and the Young Belgian Painting, whatever the media used: painting, collage, sculpture or photo. Discover this universe now !

Open on Friday and Saturday from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m. or on appointment.

item.title: Smurf store
item.body:
This is the first shop of its kind and is therefore a world first, reserved for the little blue creatures' country of origin (they were created by Peyo in 1958). A wide variety of products is available, from t-shirts and other textiles to toys and gadgets from licensees such as Leblon-Delienne, BShirt and Schleich.
 
next to the Moof museum
Opening hours: 7 days a week, from 10.00 am til 5.00 pm

item.title: Patrick Roger - Chocolatier
item.body: Known for his creativity in chocolate sculptures, Patrick Roger is characterized by combining recipes with multiple ingredients from different sources. Specialist in both classic and contemporary recipes, the chocolate maker works particularly on the aesthetics of its creations.

item.title: Collectors Gallery
item.body: Georg Jensen Jewelry, Danish silvered jewelry, and silverware. There are many original artistic creations, giving you a wide selection of original features.

item.title: Veals & Geeks
item.body: Alternative record shop specialised in various underground music, including in jazz. A great selection of magazines, gadgets, T-shirts and vinyl.

item.title: The Collector
item.body: The name says it all: an Aladdin's cave to (jazz) collectors (mainly vinyl).

item.title: Juke box Shop
item.body: LPs and singles aplenty with a limited but very good jazz department.

item.title: Galerie Champaka
item.body: Galerie Champaka introduces comic art to the Grand Sablon, a neighbourhood traditionally dedicated to the “ancient”, “modern” and “contemporary” arts. In a mansion on two floors, the gallery shows that today’s creators of comic art are true heirs of the great masters from the past, all of them ceaselessly perfecting a narrative technique which is making comics into a major contemporary artform.

item.title: Ut Pictura Musica
item.body: Record shop of the French-Belgian jazz label ‘Outnote Records’ where you can find great Belgian jazz and music style like ECM Records’.

item.title: Nespresso
item.body: The Nespresso story began with a simple but revolutionary idea: enable anyone to create the perfect cup of espresso coffee. Since 1986, Nespresso has redefined and revolutionised the way millions of people enjoy their espresso coffee.

item.title: Natan
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
Edouard Vermeulen, the designer of Natan fashion house, has brought a personal style of contemporary purity, a source of femininity and refinement. The richness of the materials lends purity to the simplicity of the forms. A style resolutely suited to an active and refined woman of today.

item.title: Bouvy
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
For over seventy years, Bouvy has provided a faultless made-to-measure and bespoke service, which occupies a privileged position within the company.The illustrious house never abandons its “chic” style which is permanent.

item.title: Max Mara
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Max Mara is a model and reference point for Italian and international prêt-à-porter; the passion and determination of the founder has been enthusiastically seized by the new generation, continuing the innovative traditions started 50 years ago.

item.title: Serneels
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
Everyone remembers the day they first opened the door of this wonderful Alladin’s cave. Ever since it was founded, the Maison Serneels has remained faithful to its philosophy: each toy is unique and remains a memory linked to a strong emotion, a spontaneous and ineffaceable feeling, a childhood memory.

item.title: Hoet Design
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
In the lively heart of trendy Brussels, a large premise was designed to display merely own creations. Hoet Optiek keeps up the same vision here: quality, innovation, classyness and communication.

item.title: Patrick Descamps-Wolfers
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
For almost two centuries, the name Wolfers has been the prestigious symbol of Belgian jewelry. It is to the splendor of the precious stones, to the subtle alliance between timeless classicism and modern boldness, that Wolfers owes its renown.

item.title: Maison Roger
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
Maison Roger is a real institution in Belgium. Prestigious hairdresser since 1935, it welcomes everybody: trendy youth, artists, business women, diplomats, aristocrats, princesses and queens.
A team of intuitive, inventive and refined experts is ready to answer the needs of clients looking for the quality of a great house.

item.title: Lionel Sonkes
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
In his intimate shop, Lionel Sonkes proposes an exclusive service of tailor-made spectacles. Passionate of optics and luxury items, he cultivates the authenticity and the cutting-edge know-how for the optimal satisfaction of the client

item.title: Marianne Gray
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
In her salon, Marianne Gray has created a real sense of relaxation and trust. It?s run by a unique team of stylists, who work closely with the colour technicians and beauty therapists. Her salon is not only a fully-fledged hair sculpture workshop, but a venue infused with a unique spirit.

item.title: Hotel Amigo Brussels
item.body: Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels

item.title: Giorgio Armani
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
The name Armani has been synonymous with unrivaled Italian style all over the world for over 30 years. Perhaps best known for revolutionizing fashion with his unstructured jacket in the Eighties, Giorgio Armani has continued to define the well dressed ever since. “Elegance is not about being noticed, it’s about being remembered”. Giorgio Armani

item.title: Chanel
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
Designer, visionary, artist, Gabrielle ‘Coco’ Chanel reinvented fashion by transcending its conventions, creating an uncomplicated luxury that changed women’s lives forever. CHANEL has continued the glorious heritage of creation, playing fearlessly with Coco’s radical legacy.
"Chanel is above all a style. Fashion passes, style remains." Gabrielle Chanel.

item.title: Louis Vuitton
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
Between a craftsman’s exceptional technique, and a designer’s vision and inventiveness, Louis Vuitton offers its expertise to bring elegance and distinctiveness to its creations: shoes, watches, leather goods, ready-to-wear, jewelry and accessories. A Louis Vuitton piece is not just a product; it is the embodiment of incomparable savoir-faire and refined quality.

item.title: Tod's
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
Tod's the finest of Made in Italy in men's and women's shoes, bags and small leather goods Handcrafted, contemporary designs the essence of luxury and timeless style. Only the highest standard of leather is used in the creation of a Tod’s shoe or bag, cut, treated and sewn by hand.

item.title: Hermès
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
 
 In 1837 Thierry Hermes opened his workshop making the finest quality harnesses and saddles in the heart of Paris. Today Hermes is still a family company whose craftspeople make, often by hand and always with love , bags and belts, diaries and dishes, scarves and shoes, perfumes and purses, ties and travelling furniture, as well as gloves, hats, watches, jewellery and clothes.

item.title: Baobab collection
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
The handmade candles, produced in Belgium since 2004, bring us the full magnitude of their African heritage through exclusive fragrances that plunge you into the cradle of humanity. The Belgian brand is committed to certain values including high-quality craftsmanship and respect for the environment. The wax, mineral and non-oily, is the best guarantee of purity.

item.title: BMW Brussels
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
 
 
 
 
BMW Brussels is much more than a prestigious showcase for the BMW marque in the centre of Brussels. It’s a window opening onto the high-flying world of BMW.

item.title: Rouge Tomate
item.body: With one restaurant in Brussels and another in New-York, Rouge Tomate bases its cooking on the SPE nutritional charter, which includes balanced recipes designed both by chefs and dieticians. Note that the wine list is the work of Pascaline Lepeltier, runner-up as France?s best sommelier in 2008.

item.title: Senzanome
item.body: Located in Schaarbeek, the Senza Nome is one of the two Italian restaurants that have been awarded stars in the capital. The restaurant offers a distinctive menu that changes with the seasons.

item.title: Belvas
item.body:
In a charming and atypical environment, Belvas’ shop will make you discover high quality and superior taste chocolates. Its chocolate is the only organic, handmade and faire trade. Don’t hesitate and go discover Belvas chocolate already rewarded with many prices (quality food award, Superior taste award…).
 
Open Tuesday to Sunday, 10.30AM to 6.30PM
Exceptionally open Monday February 10th 2014

item.title: Café Tasse
item.body:
More than just a chocolate brand, Café-Tasse reflects a life style, gourmet luxury. Authenticity is a fundamental value for the brand and traditional craftsmanship lies at the heart of the family company’s manufacturing philosophy.
The Café-Tasse shop, just off the Grand Place, exudes the pleasure of chocolate, inviting a stroll in its direction. The pale wooden furniture, oak floor, soft lighting, patinated walls and contemporary note of metal create the perfect atmosphere in which to indulge the taste buds.

Open Monday to Saturday, 10.30 to 18.30 and Sunday 12 noon to 18.00.

item.title: Delacre
item.body:
The “Delacre” brand, which has been in existence for 120 years, is widely distributed throughout the world. Based on traditional recipes, the quality and delicacy of Delacre biscuits, with their often unique and exclusive characteristics, appeal to lovers of fine food.
The Delacre shop, near the Manneken-Pis, invites passers-by to discover Delacre’s traditional biscuits, together with their hand-crafted biscuits and cigarettes russes.
 
Open from Tuesday to Sunday, from 11AM to 6.30PM
item.address: Place de la Vieille Halle aux Blé 27/Oude Korenhuisplein 27

item.title: Concept Chocolate
item.body:
Concept Chocolate business philosophy is based on personalisation of the products: caraques or pralines with company logos, two or three dimensional items, packaging specially designed for celebrations and events. Chocolate shaped specifically for the client is not only a delicious and convivial product, but also an excellent communication and publicity tool.

Open Monday to Friday, 9.00 to 17.00 and weekends by arrangement.

item.title: Vandeparre
item.body:
The Vandeparre chocolate factory is located 50 metres from the Place Saint-Job in Uccle. A meeting place for the flavours of the world coated in the finest chocolate.
 
The outdoor terrace and tasting room are two delightful places to discover hand-made ice creams, home-made macaroons and the house specialities, grand cru, single origin pralines.
 
Open from Monday to Thursday, from 10AM to 6PM. Friday and Saturday, from 10AM to 7PM
item.address: Avenue Jean et Pierre Carsoel, 7 /Jean et Pierre Carsoellaan, 7

item.title: Leonidas Sablon
item.body:
It’s almost Valentines Day! An important moment for our Master-Chocolatier who wants to be at the heart of tenderness and sharing. Leonidas plays the card of romance by proposing its delicious chocolate hearts: Grapefruit in white chocolate, Lemon in dark chocolate, Vanilla in milk chocolate en Raspberry in white chocolate with a natural pink colour. Because even when you are in love, each person will keep its personal taste for chocolates!
 
Open from Monday to Saturday, from 10AM to 7PM en Sunday, from 10AM to 6PM

item.title: Leonidas Ixelles
item.body:
Leonidas, the famous Master Chocolatier, opens the door to its safe and reveals the Gia d’Or, a veritable chocolate treasure trove. Leonidas produces wonderful full-size gold ingots containing the famous Gia range of chocolates: the Gianduja, Giantina and Giamanda, to delight the lovers of creamy pralines still further.

Open Monday to Saturday, 9.00 to 18h30 and Sunday 10.00 to 18.00.

item.title: Leonidas Louise
item.body:
Leonidas, the famous Master Chocolatier, opens the door to its safe and reveals the Gia d’Or, a veritable chocolate treasure trove. Leonidas produces wonderful full-size gold ingots containing the famous Gia range of chocolates: the Gianduja, Giantina and Giamanda, to delight the lovers of creamy pralines still further.

Open Monday to Saturday, 10.00 to 18.30.

item.title: Maison Bruyerre - Grand’ Place
item.body:
Using the finest raw materials and the most sophisticated recipes, Bruyerre has developed a range of artisanal chocolates renowned for its interior such as hazelnut praline, ganache and gianduja. Bruyerre’s chocolates know no borders and are exported worldwide.
 
Open daily, from 10:00 to 22:00

item.title: Planète Chocolat
item.body:
Located just between the Grand’Place and the Manneken-Pis, Planète Chocolat invites you to enter its artisanal premises. You’ll discover there a temple of chocolate with, right in the middle of the demonstration areas (maximum capacity of 200 people), its workshop and its personalised museum recalling the extraordinary, fabulous history of cacao. With its 55,000 visitors per annum, Planète Chocolat has become an unmissable event venue, the true ambassador of Belgian chocolate’s image.
 
 
Open from Tuesday to Saturday, from 10AM to 6.30PM. Monday and Sunday, from 11AM to 6PM
www.planetechocolat.com  
www.chocolaterie-bruxelles.com

item.title: Manon
item.body:
At Master Chocolatier Manon, in keeping with a tradition dating back to the beginning of the last century, each praline is hand-crafted, delicately adding the subtlest of fragrances and flavours; some chocolates are assembled in up to three different stages.
 
Entirely natural ingredients and almost daily deliveries are what give Manon chocolates their freshness and unique quality.
 
Open Tuesday to Saturday, 10.30AM to 5.30PM

item.title: Passion Chocolat - Rue Bodenbroek
item.body:
The philosophy behind Passion Chocolat is crystal clear: to combine passion and pleasure! A philosophy that Passion Chocolat shares with its customers. The hand-crafting of the pralines is the key to their success. Passion Chocolat selects the best ingredients and employs traditional production methods.
 
 
 
Open Monday to Saturday, 10AM to 8PM & Sunday, 10AM to 6PM

item.title: Leonidas - rue au Beurre
item.body:
It’s almost Valentines Day! An important moment for our Master-Chocolatier who wants to be at the heart of tenderness and sharing. Leonidas plays the card of romance by proposing its delicious chocolate hearts: Grapefruit in white chocolate, Lemon in dark chocolate, Vanilla in milk chocolate en Raspberry in white chocolate with a natural pink colour. Because even when you are in love, each person will keep its personal taste for chocolates!
 
Open daily, from 10AM to 11PM

item.title: Leonidas Anspach
item.body:
It’s almost Valentines Day! An important moment for our Master-Chocolatier who wants to be at the heart of tenderness and sharing. Leonidas plays the card of romance by proposing its delicious chocolate hearts: Grapefruit in white chocolate, Lemon in dark chocolate, Vanilla in milk chocolate en Raspberry in white chocolate with a natural pink colour. Because even when you are in love, each person will keep its personal taste for chocolates!
 
Open from Monday to Friday from 9AM to 8PM, Saturday from 9AM to 7PM and Sunday from 9.30AM to 6PM

item.title: Maison Bruyerre - Rue au Beurre
item.body:
Using the finest raw materials and the most sophisticated recipes, Bruyerre has developed a range of artisanal chocolates renowned for its interior such as hazelnut praline, ganache and gianduja. Bruyerre’s chocolates know no borders and are exported worldwide.
 
Open daily, from 10:00 to 22:00

item.title: Passion Chocolat - Grand Sablon (NH hotel)
item.body:
The philosophy behind Passion Chocolat is crystal clear: to combine passion and pleasure! A philosophy that Passion Chocolat shares with its customers. The hand-crafting of the pralines is the key to their success. Passion Chocolat selects the best ingredients and employs traditional production methods.
 
 
 
Open Monday to Saturday, 10AM to 8PM & Sunday, 10AM to 6PM

item.title: Le Saint-Aulaye
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
Based in Ixelles since 1986, Saint-Aulaye is a patisserie specialised in producing the highest quality traditional French pastry. Pure classics or totally original, the pastries of Saint-Aulaye have one thing in common: absolutely outstanding quality.

item.title: InStore
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
For over 30 years, Instore has offered the very best contemporary designer brands in their 1500 m2 showroom, where the various spaces evolve depending on their selections and the latest trends.

item.title: Aquamass
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
Aquamass was one of the first companies to devise a bathroom that took possession of space and was conceived as a real place dedicated to wellbeing, first of all from 1978 with its Wellness range and then today with its design range. Aquamass uses its know-how with the talent of the greatest modern designers to make the bath an object, a sculpture, a dream.

item.title: Immobilière Le Lion
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
The Immobilière Le Lion agency is specialized for 40 years in the sale of high quality and top class properties in the most sought after residential neighbourhoods of Brussels and surrounding areas. If you wish to rent or sell your property, do not hesitate to consult this real estate agency.
The Continents Insolites traveller is above all a traveler of prestige. He is seeking to evoke true emotions: standing starry eyed at dramatic skies, breathing in the pungent aromas of the earth after summer rains. He enters wild jungles, climbs golden sand dunes or the steps of ancient archealogical sites, all with the same fervent passion. Continents Insolites is the Belgian bespoke travel specialist.

item.title: Continents Insolites
item.body:
Member of Brussels Exclusive Labels
The Continents Insolites traveller is above all a traveler of prestige. He is seeking to evoke true emotions: standing starry eyed at dramatic skies, breathing in the pungent aromas of the earth after summer rains. He enters wild jungles, climbs golden sand dunes or the steps of ancient archealogical sites, all with the same fervent passion. Continents Insolites is the Belgian bespoke travel specialist.

item.title: La Crypte Tonique
item.body: Open : tuesday to saturday from 12 to 6pm

item.title: Piola.libri
item.body:
Piola Libri invites you to discover and rediscover Italy through books of all genres. We offer a wide literary selection in original Italian and bilingual versions, as well as French and Dutch translations.
 
 
In a charming and relaxed atmosphere you are invited to browse our new releases or select from our extensive catalogue of classic and modern Italian literature, a virtual cornucopia of literary choice.
 
Also available are a wide selection of travel guides, art books, volumes of poetry, comic books and of course a delicious assortment of Italian cook books, wine guides, and literature about food.
 
A dedicated children’s section offers books and DVDs for kids of all ages. Special interactive kid’s events are arranged on a regular basis with children’s authors and book readings.
 
In a word everything you need to satisfy your literary desires or to find the perfect gift idea for someone else or even yourself!

item.title: shop-Library Maelström
item.body:
(not available) MaelstrÖm signifie " gouffre ", " tourbillon "... ReEvolution renvoie à rêve, à révolution, à rêve d'évolution, et aux actes de réévolution poétique bien sûr

Phénomène naturel situé géographiquement près des côtes norvégiennes, juste au-delà du cercle polaire. Phénomène métaphorique situé dans le Yin Yang de notre esprit, là où la lumière n’existe que par l’ombre qu’elle projette et où l’ombre est la condition de naissance de la lumière.
La première symbolique renvoie à la nouvelle Une Descente dans le Maelström d’Edgar Allan Poe…
 
Maeström est né en 1990 comme groupe ouvert d’artistes, poètes et écrivains en tout genre, entre Rome, Bruxelles et Paris. Des productions de spectacles musicaux et théâtraux, des productions cinématographiques ont vu le jour… Une revue bilingue français-italien a même compté 3 numéros avant de se fondre dans une collection de livres d’abord chez Edifie L.L.N. (1996) puis chez Images d’Yvoires (2001).
 
 
En 2003, Maelström est devenu une maison d’édition et a participé à la création du réseau de RéÉvolution Poétique en 2002 (Bombardement poétique à Gênes, Attentat Poétique du 11.09.03), ainsi que du 1er OFF du Livre à Bruxelles, salon du livre OFF... Des dizaines de livres ont été édités, plus de 60 booklegs aussi, ces livrets de l'instant, de performance...

item.title: ScanShop
item.body: The ScanShop in central Brussels opened in 2009. The shop is conveniently located only a stone’s throw from the European Parliament, Commission and Council, surrounded by restaurants and cafés with nice terraces, in a pedestrian street some 100 meters from Place Jourdan. In the Brussels ScanShop you’ll find the latest issues of many Nordic magazines and daily newspapers, buns fresh from the oven and most of the products one typically misses whilst away from one’s home country. Although the product range offered in the Brussels shop is slightly more limited than in the other two branches due to the smaller size of the shop itself, customers can always order additional products from ScanShop Waterloo if there’s anything they cannot find in Brussels.

item.title: Smets premium store brussels
item.body:
The Luxembourger multibrand store SMETS, the new fashion temple in Brussels, is now also situated on the Chaussée de Louvain. Its 3800 m² mixes fashion, design and contemporary art. A lot of brands are present: 80 brands of prêt-à-porter for women, 20 for men, jewels, shoes, accessories, design and a beauty corner.
 
Opening hours
Mon-Sat 11am-7pm

item.title: Christofle
item.body: Fascinating decorative objects, futuristic sculptures, architectural works of art? These are the questions raised by Christofle with its new line of Haute Orfèvrerie, a collection that proves the brand hasn?t lost sight of what it loves to do best: astonish, question; innovate. In sum, fill with wonder.

item.title: Gallery Bruxelles-Paris
item.body:
The Gallery, located in the very centre of Bruxelles, 5 minutes away from the Grand Place and the central Station, between the Manneken-Pis and the Sablon settles to exhibit graphic art pieces, especially comic strips.
 
The Vieille Halle au Blé is located at the foot of the first surrounding city wall vestiges. It was named from the 13th century after the wheat hall.
It then turned over the centuries into a departure place for the diligences going to Amsterdam, Luxembourg and Paris, to finally become an outstanding 150 m2 space, in a XVIIe century house with a baroque facade.
 
The gallery owners will offer a dozen of exhibitions per year, original drawing boards, illustrations as well as a shop presenting rare books, curiosities, engravings, rehauts, various collector's item, unusual and nowhere else to be found.
 
(Comic strips aperitifs). On some occasions, the gallery will turn into a space where artists and fans can meet during signing sessions.
 
Hours: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday from 11:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. and Sunday from 11:00 a.m to 4:00
item.address: Place de la Vieille Halle aux Bles 29/Oud Korenhuis 29

item.title: Passé-Passion
item.body: Ancient toys and antiques.

item.title: Les petits poissons
item.body: This store is a true treasure trove for mums and kids. Julie, owner and professional restorer, hunts around for vintage kids’ furniture to jazz it up with contemporary elements.

item.title: Chez Modes
item.body: Since last August, boutique “Modes”, genuine temple of antique and vintage textile, formerly located rue Blaes, now settled in the beautifully renovated fire station. The place is definitely bigger and more elegant.

item.title: HOUSE OF WUNDERS
item.body: For all lovers of interior design amongst you, this place is more than worth the detour. Owner Steve Angri proposes furniture, genuine fossils and art pieces which he tracked down during his countless trips abroad.

item.title: L’atelier en ville
item.body: This superb concept store has loads in store for you: delicious food (bagels, tarts and cakes, sandwiches…), happenings, eclectic furniture and unique fashion items. Don’t hesitate to drop in if you happen to be in the vicinity!

item.title: Art’s Power
item.body: Art’s Power spotlights the work of young artist Isysia, also owner of the store. She sells clothing which she has carefully selected and sometimes also customized as well own jewellery pieces.

item.title: La Belgique Gourmande
item.body:
As its name indicates, “La Belgique Gourmande” offers a wide range of Belgian delicacies and specialties. Brussels waffles, speculoos biscuits, chocolates, macarons, all offered in a box with posters from the 30s, advices, tastings… Each elements is there to make your way at “La Belgique Gourmande” a wonderful journey through culinary delights of yesteryear and today.
 
Open daily, from 10AM tot 10PM

item.title: On air
item.body:
Featuring a vintage decor complete with old radios, On Air offers a selection of printed t-shirts for women and men. Original and trendy, the collection combines style, humour and rock & roll.
 
To be worn boldly with rolled-up jeans or a jacket, so as to achieve the desired effect.

item.title: The Cartoonist
item.body:
The Cartoonist opens its doors. From now on our capital has gained a special place: a separate location for the Belgian press cartoonists.
 
The archive of the participating cartoonists is accessible and collected on the website www.thecartoonist.be. In addition, their work can be seen in the gallery bearing the same name and located in the Marolles district.
 
At the gallery they organize solo as well as themed exhibitions.

item.title: Influences
item.body: Founded by Pierre De Brouwere and Beatrice Cousin about four years ago, this little jewel in the vintage-loaded Brugman neighbourhood is not only a furniture shop but an art gallery, too. The carefully arranged space and selection hint at true passionates at work: the couple specialise in Belgian contemporary abstract art and Scandinavian and Belgian furniture pieces from the ’50s, ’60s and ’70s.

item.title: Vintage Items
item.body: Vintage Items, again located in Ixelles’ Brugman neighbourhood, is notable for its playful and colourful knick-knacks from the ’60s to the ’80s. Owner Tim Dubus makes sure to always have some grand classics available, from Marcel Breuer chairs to pieces by Eames or Jacobsen. His speciality is the multi-coloured vintage letters that are perfect for an original wall decoration.

item.title: XXth Century Furniture
item.body: Located in Brussels’ antique shop mecca, the Sablon area, Olivier Biltereyst runs XXth Century Furniture, a place that offers a selection of rather traditional, elegant and sophisticated items. We particularly loved the Danish two-seat leather sofa from the ’70s, as well as Belgian designer Jules Wabbes’ large ’60s bookshelf. Speaking of which: the space also includes an art bookshop run by Laurent Bouchat.

item.title: Alexis Vanhove
item.body: Despite – or maybe because of – the limited size of his shop, Alexis Vanhove’s selection is spot-on and extremely personal. The tiny space leaves room for only the true coup de coeurs chosen by this studied art historian. Once again located in Brussels’ Brugman area, the shop has attracted vintage design fans since 2008. On the menu are a selection of gorgeous pieces from Belgian design star Jules Wabbes, the sober but elegant tables of George Nelson and Arne Jacobsen’s legendary Series 7 chairs.

item.title: Le Petit Coin
item.body: Located in the Flagey area and run by three friends, Le Petit Coin is a charming little corner shop that also offers some choice finds for the smaller wallet. Apart from furniture, it’s full of little bits and pieces from cushions, plates, cups and lots of different deco objects. Fair warning: not everything here is vintage.

item.title: D+ Design
item.body: Italian-born Allessandro Dati is passionate about 20th century furniture and decorative objects, and has an obvious penchant for Italian design. Here you’ll find creations by Gio Ponti, Ettore Sottsass or Joe Colombo, but also a few pieces from Europe or the US. Our favourite find: the many different models of Guzzini lamps.

item.title: Via Antica
item.body: Located in the Marolles, this gigantic space is a Goliath of Belgium’s vintage design scene. Covering 2000 metres sq. and three floors, Via Antica unites the wares of 40 different dealers, including a whole array of different styles and covering a wide range of pieces from the 18th to the 20th century. Next to Scandinavian masterpieces from the ’70s there’s art deco lamps and ancient pharmacy shelves. Quite the treasure chest.

item.title: C’Ki le Roi
item.address: 38, Avenue du Roi Chevalier/Avenue du Roi Chevalier38
